text: A random sample of size 16 is drawn from a normal population with variance σ² = 25. If the sample variance is s² = 36, what is the chi-square statistic for this test?
For a chi-square distribution with 12 degrees of freedom, what is the mean and variance?
explanation: For chi-square distribution: μ = v = 12, σ² = 2v = 24

text: A quality control test uses 8 batteries from a production line. The population standard deviation is known to be 2 minutes. If the sample standard deviation is 3 minutes, what is the chi-square statistic?
For a chi-square distribution with 5 degrees of freedom, what is P(χ² ≤ 1.15) approximately?
explanation: From the chi-square table, for v=5, χ²=1.15 corresponds to probability ≈ 0.10

text: A sample of 20 observations from a normal population has s² = 18. If σ² = 16, what is the chi-square statistic?
What is the probability that a chi-square value with 3 degrees of freedom exceeds 7.82?
explanation: From the chi-square table, for v=3, χ²=7.82 corresponds to probability 0.05 in the right tail

A random sample of 15 items from a normal population has variance 25. The population variance is 20. What is the chi-square statistic?
For a chi-square distribution with 8 degrees of freedom, what is P(χ² > 13.36)?
explanation: From the chi-square table, for v=8, χ²=13.36 corresponds to probability 0.10 in the right tail

text: The chi-square distribution is a special case of which distribution?
explanation: Chi-square distribution is a special case of Gamma distribution with α = k/2 and β = 2

text: If X ~ χ²(6), what are the parameters for the equivalent Gamma distribution?
explanation: For chi-square with k df, equivalent Gamma has α = k/2 = 3, β = 2

What does f₀.₀₅(6,10) represent?
explanation: f₀.₀₅(v₁,v₂) refers to value with cumulative probability (1-0.05)=0.95
